Current #wildfire risk reduction goals are so abstract. How do we know we’re on the right track and successfully reducing wildfire risk? We need measurable targets so we can consistently track progress+investments by levels+stakeholders. Time for a regional WNA wildfire compact?

If portable air cleaners are not available during a #wildfire, a temporary air purifier can be assembled to help reduce smoke exposure.

✅ Use 2012 model or newer
🔌 Do not leave unattended
⚠️ Replace filter as needed
➡️ https://t.co/RkaAndfR6Y
#SmokeReadyCA #IAQ https://t.co/ZEfT4OUVdw

California has experienced its most destructive #wildfire seasons in recent years. Be #SmokeReadyCA!

📍 check local AQI
🔥 avoid breathing smoke
😷 use N95 masks
🔄 use MERV 13+ air filters
🔌 use CARB-certified air cleaners
🏠 set up clean air space

➡️ https://t.co/PSHrsXzIHr https://t.co/sEw8e4OvPo

14/ To help you make decisions related to #wildfire smoke episodes in your area, these are great and freely available tools. My favorite is the AirNow Smoke/Fire Map: https://t.co/njuydtIgW2.

https://t.co/UgctXB17NH

11/ So yes, high-quality (N95) masks are great against #wildfire smoke, but an imp. 1st approach is to avoid the smoke or go to a cleaner indoor environment.

For details on how to get yourself some clean air, read this by indoor air quality expert @etgall
https://t.co/qrqSWG3EpK

A 🧵 to counter some confusing messages about masks & wildfire smoke (1/x)

1. High-quality masks (i.e. #N95) best for both viral aerosol + #wildfire smoke
2. N95s readily available & should be used for both
3. But other masks can provide non-zero benefit
https://t.co/mjuaocal8B

Help your home survive #wildfire: 
- Careful design and maintenance of landscaping.
- Awareness of combustible materials on the property such as leaf litter and wood piles.
- Incorporation of #fire- and ember-resistant construction materials. More ➡️ https://t.co/dCoDn56mdX https://t.co/CbjR5Kzf0j

#Wildfire alters #snowpack processes long after the fire occurs. 

Our new paper in the Journal of #Hydrology shows increases in temperature and response to air temperature in the snowpack surrounding fire-affected tree stems 15-16 years post-#bushfire.
